title: Kind of Minion pro font but not exactly
content:
Some of the characters of this logo are similar to Minion Pro font but M character is more linear so I am a bit comfused.

Font: 

 Times New Roman 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172308/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo-originál (2).jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172308/http:/typophile.com/files/logo-origin%C3%A1l%20(2).jpg) | 190.91 KB |
author: brunko

comments.content: It looks like a further emboldened **[Times New Roman (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172308/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=MS-Windows-Fonts&ffam=Times%20New%20Roman%20-%20Bold&fid=bdc72738cf3fb5306bf5af787891a82a&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=PROFIREMONT&wrap=2)** + a thick outline stroke
I was thinking about that one too but seems that playing around with font in PS made me comfused (ending pins looked sharp not like cutted). I tried it in IL and seen just fine.
